title: SAGESA Research and Training Network Activities
text: In 2021, the SAGESA project established a research and training network, to facilitate capacity building for pathogen genomics and surveillance of anti-microbial resistance (AMR) in Africa. The SAGESA project is funded by the Cambridge Africa ALBORADA Research Fund, and is a collaboration by scientists from the National Institute of Communicable Diseases in South Africa, the Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences, University of Zimbabwe, Wellcome Connecting Science and the Centre for Genomic Pathogen Surveillance.

title: SAGESA Research and Training Network Activities
text: In 2021, the SAGESA project established a research and training network, to facilitate capacity building for pathogen genomics and surveillance of anti-microbial resistance (AMR) in Africa. The SAGESA project is funded by the Cambridge Africa ALBORADA Research Fund, and is a collaboration by scientists from the National Institute of Communicable Diseases in South Africa, the Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences, University of Zimbabwe, Wellcome Connecting Science and the Centre for Genomic Pathogen Surveillance.

title: SAGESA Research and Training Network Activities
text:
Project goal
The goal of this project was to establish a peer network platform which provides access to training and expertise to scientists interested in genomics of disease pathogens and surveillance of antimicrobial resistance (AMR).

title: SAGESA Research and Training Network Activities
text:
Objectives
● Establish the training and research network for genomic surveillance of AMR in Africa
● Provide training for bioinformatics in AMR genomics in the SADC region
● Establish collaborative research and training projects for AMR surveillance

title: SAGESA Research and Training Network Activities
text:
Target audience
Scientists based anywhere in the world interested in developing skills and resources for AMR genomics in Africa and globally.

title: SAGESA Research and Training Network Activities
text:
Joining the network
To join the network simply contact us or access an online form for providing basic personal information, country of origin and consent for use of media for promotional purposes by the collaborating organisations.
THE SAGESA Core Team developed activities encompassing virtual meetings and training and facilitated a network of scientists interested in sharing knowledge and skills i n genomics of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) Africa.
The SAGESA launch meeting, held in November 2021, facilitated the introduction of initial network members - approximately 50 at the time. This was followed by a needs assessment workshop to explore network, research and training needs in Africa.

title: SAGESA Research and Training Network Activities
text:
Workshop objectives
● Official launch of SAGESA Network - the first Africa AMR genomics research and
training network.
● Discuss needs and gaps within the region with regards to application of
genomics for AMR surveillance - a focus on training needs and network development.
● Provide an overview of the planned/proposed SAGESA activities and discuss the future of the network.
A virtual hybrid model used live discussion of topics and the Padlet platform where participants provided detailed information about - the current status of training and research, training needs and research interests, and expectations of SAGESA network.

title: AMR Research and Training Network Resources
text:
AMR Research and Training Network Resources
Sequencing Tools - Taya Forde
WGS Data Analysis Pipelines - Stanford Kwenda
Scientific Workflows and Galaxy - Peter van Heusden
AMR Prediction Tools and Databases - Narender Kumar
Rapid Microbial Analysis Pipeline - rMAP - Ivan Sserwadda_Gerald Mboowa
A Global Resource for Genomic Pathogen Surveillance at Pathogenwatch - Silvia Argimon
Grant Writing Elements - Helena Kuivanemi

title: SAGESA - An African AMR Genomics Network Resource
text: Explore tools and resources for pathogen genomics and AMR

title: Explore tools and resources for pathogen genomics and AMR
text:
About SAGESA
The SAGESA project established a research and training network, as an important step in building capacity for pathogen genomics and surveillance of anti-microbial resistance (AMR) in Africa. The SAGESA project is funded by the Cambridge Africa ALBORADA Research Fund, and is a collaboration by scientists from the National Institute of Communicable Diseases in South Africa, the Faculty of Medicine and Health Sciences, University of Zimbabwe, Wellcome Connecting Science and the Centre for Genomic Pathogen Surveillance.

title: Explore tools and resources for pathogen genomics and AMR
text:
Network and Training Activities
SAGESA activities consisted of a launch workshop to establish the network; monthly 2-hour webinar sessions and a 3 day bioinformatics workshop. To find out more about the network to date, curriculum and training activities activities click on the links below
SAGESA Network Activities and Curriculum
AMR Genomics Webinar Resources
AMR Bioinformatics Workshop
